intro: Rudbeckia odorata, commonly known as the sweet coneflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow-orange ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which are often visited by bees and butterflies. Rudbeckia odorata typically grows in prairies and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in supporting pollinator populations.
